Key Match Events: The Sixers dropped their fifth straight game in a 116-106 loss to the Lakers.
Guerschon Yabusele forced several errant passes, travels, and jammed-up possessions in the first half.
Jared McCain hit a pair of threes contributing to a big run from the bench in the second quarter.
Caleb Martin made at least two threes for the first time this season.
Andre Drummond scored through contact for an and-one against Anthony Davis.
Post-Match Reflections: The Sixers continued a nightmare start to their season, dropping to 1-7.
Paul George's minutes were limited to protect his health, affecting his rhythm and performance.
The Sixers have been struggling in the third quarter throughout the season.
Kyle Lowry struggled to score inside the arc due to lack of separation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers played the Goldeneye64 watch music at the end of the game.
